text: In this video, I look at how the Spanish Civil War shaped the literature of the modernist movement. George Orwell and Ernest Hemingway both visited Spain during the war, and T.S. Eliot and W.H. Auden asked questions about a poet's duty in the modern world. https://youtu.be/30_vpxuWx4c

# interestingbackstory famous novelist Ernest Hemingway met George Orwell early in his career when they both volunteered for the Republic of Spain in the Spanish Civil War they would respectively write For Whom the Bells Toll and Homage to Catalonia the latter being less succesful
George Orwell and his dog during the Spanish Civil War, in the background can be seen Ernest Hemingway pic.twitter.com/3D9oXkH0gt

It's an innaurately captioned photo. It's that Ernest Hemingway stands in the background in the photo and the Spanish Civil War too. The man holding the bear no resemblance whatsoever with George Orwell.
